Title: Stop blaming the system, start transforming it, expert tells future surgeons
Summary: Dr Julius Oni has urged aspiring surgeons to rise above mediocrity and become agents of change in the healthcare system . Oni is an Associate Professor of Orthopaedic Surgery at Johns Hopkins University . He now practices in Nigeria after a successful career in the US .

Title: Police cordon off PDP national secretariat ahead of NEC meeting
Summary: As early as 8:30 a.m. on Monday, no fewer than 70 armed policemen took strategic positions around Wadata Plaza . The police have deployed heavily armed officers to the National Secretariat of the Peoples Democratic Party (PDP)

Title: CCTV captures Nigerian carer abusing 88-year-old dementia patient before death
Summary: CCTV captures the brutal assault on an 88-year-old dementia patient before death . Bilikesu Olagunju, a Nigerian carer, abused the dementia patient . The man died just days after suffering violent abuse from a care worker .

Title: Kuteb-Tiv coalition dismisses critics, insists group is not a fan club
Summary: The leadership of the Kuteb/Tiv Coalition in Taraba State has declared that the group is not a mere ‘fan club’ but a platform of strategic thinkers committed to advancing the political interests of historically marginalised communities in the state .

Title: CSO seeks NJC’s action against alleged breach in Ekiti chief judge appointment
Summary: Civil Society Organisation, Citizens Gavel, has called on the National Judicial Council (NJC) to intervene in the controversial nomination . CSO seeks NJC’s action against alleged breach in Ekiti chief judge appointment .

Title: UK-based Nigerian caregiver jailed for manhandling 88-yr-old man
Summary: Olagunju pleaded guilty at Woolwich Crown Court to one count of ill-treating or willfully neglecting an individual in her care . The 42-year-old was jailed for manhandling the 88-yr-old man .

Title: 871,000 die from loneliness every year – WHO
Summary: Soon, all children and teenagers in Sweden will receive prepaid cards that can only be used to book group leisure activities . Soon, they will be able to use the prepaid cards to book activities .

Title: I will contest in 2027 election – Peter Obi
Summary: Obi also dismissed speculations that he had discussed or had agreed to a joint ticket with former Vice President Atiku Abububarar . Obi said he will contest in 2027 election .

Title: Dantata: Nigerian delegation arrives Saudi Arabia ahead of burial
Summary: Nigerian delegation arrives Saudi Arabia ahead of burial of late business icon . Alhaji Aminu Dantata will be buried in the Islamic holy city of Madinah .

Title: NELFUND disowns message claiming reopening of loan portal
Summary: NELFUND disowns message claiming reopening of loan portal . Agency urged the general public, especially students, parents, and guardians, to avoid clicking on unverified links .

Title: Minister orders UNIUYO to revise VC advert amidst strike threat
Summary: The Minister of Education, Dr. Tunji Alausa, has directed the University of Uyo, Akwa Ibom State, to withdraw its current advertisement for the position of the Vice-Chancellor in the institution . This directive follows a protest by the clinical lecturers under the aegis of the Medical and Dental Consult

Title: Israel eyes peace accords with Syria, Lebanon
Summary: Israeli Foreign Minister Gideon Saar tells journalists his government wants more normalisation agreements with Arab countries . Saar insists the strategic plateau, which Israel seized in 1967, “will remain part of the State of Israel” under any future peace agreement . Control of the Israeli-occupied Golan Heights has long been a source of tension between

Title: APC isn't the party of my dreams, M.I Abaga admits mistake
Summary: Nigerian rapper, Jude Abaga, popularly known as M.I, has admitted that he made a mistake by supporting the All Progressives Congress during the 2015 elections . The award-winning artiste, in a recent episode of the Menism podcast, explained that his support for the APC stemmed from his disillusionment with the then

Title: Nigerian delegation arrives Saudi Arabia ahead of Dantata’s burial
Summary: Nigerian delegation has arrived in Madinah, Saudi Arabia, ahead of the burial of Aminu Dantata . The delegation, which departed Nigeria late Sunday, touched down in the holy city early Monday . Leading the team is the Minister of Defence and former Jigawa State Governor, Muhammad Badaru Abubakar .

Title: Over 870,000 people die annually from loneliness — WHO
Summary: One in six people worldwide is affected by loneliness, which, along with social isolation, can lead to physical illness . Causes include illness, poor education, low income, a lack of opportunities for social interaction, living alone and the use of digital technologies .
